questions.text: Krüppel-like factor-2 (KLF2) is associated with Dilated
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

In laminar blood flow KLF 2 Is secreted which decrease chances of ATH

choices.text: Earliest manifestation will be cold induced Ravnaud's phenomenon.
Segmental thrombosis will be involving vein, artery, and nerves.
Intermittent claudication is never seen in these patients

questions.text: 25-year-old male with history of smoking from past 11 years came with findings given below. Which of the following will be incorrect statement about this disorder?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Most specific symptom of BUERGERS ds is intermittent claudication

choices.text: Caterpillar like nuclear chromatin is seen in Anitschkow cells.
Fish mouth mitral stenosis is due to fibrosis and calcification.

questions.text: A 38-year-old male patient presented with severe dyspnea . On echocardiography, it was showing mitral stenosis with left atrium hypertrophy. Histopathology of vegetations from mitral, valve is seen as given in below Image. All of the following statements are true about this condition, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Aschoff giant cells are diagnostic and not anitschow cells.

choices.text: Beta- MHC (Myosin Heavy Chain gene mutation

questions.text: A 30-year-old male suffers from congestive heart failure and died suddenly. He has no history of drug abuse, valvular disease, or systemic disorder. Myocardial histopathology is shown in the given image. These morphologic features are most consistent with which mutation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

This is Helter skelter myofibre disarray associated with beta-MHC mutation in hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy

questions.text: Based on below given images most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Wooly hairs.hyperkeratosis of soles ans fat replacement of myocytes are features of NAXOS Syndrome.

questions.text: In Lobar pneumonia, the presence of fibrinosuppurative exudate with disintegration of red cells is seen in the tsage of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

choices.text: Its a Curschmann spiralis containing mucous plug
It is associated with type IlI Hypersensitivity reactions

questions.text: A patient with obstructive pulmonary disorder was examined cytologically and finding is shown below. Which of the following is true about this image?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Charcot leyden crystals are made up of galectin-10.

choices.text: Progression of lesion even after stopping exposure to asbestos.
Nodular lesions initially involves upper lobe
Adenocarcinoma is most common cancer associated with asbestosis.

questions.text: Asbestosis of the lung is associated with all of the following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nodular lesions involving upper lobe is feature of silicosis whereas asbestosis involves lower lobe .

questions.text: 45-year-old male, an asbestos factory worker has presented with lung mass. Ultrastructural examination has revealed findings which are shown in image. Most likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Multiple branching desmosomes on EM is feature of mesothelioma

questions.text: A 45-year-old smoker presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied. Histopathology is shown in given Image. Which of the following will be true about this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Azzopardi effect is feature of small cell ca which is positive for chromogranin.

choices.text: Most common paraneoplastic syndrome associated is Hypercalcemia
It will be positive for neurofilament.
Salt and pepper like nuclear chromatin.
It is associated with Azzopardi effect.

questions.text:
A 42-year-old smoker male presented with lung mass, and mass was biopsied.H istopathology is shown in given Image.

Which of the following is not true about this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

MC PNS of small cell is SIADH

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl is presenting with cola coloured urine. on physical examination her blood pressure was 154/100 mmHg. Renal biopsy was performed and electron microscopy was showing the features shown in below given image. Most likely diagnosis in this case will be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Subepithelial hump is feature of PSGN or acute proliferative nephritis

choices.text: Semilunar structures consists of Parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and monocytes.
Most important factor in crescent formation is Fibrin.
Crescents are not characteristic finding of RPGN
Rupture of basement membrane is seen.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about RPGN?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cresecents are characterstic of RPGN.

choices.text: Most commonly associated with Membranous nephropathy.
Most commonly associated with Diffuse proliferative glomerulopathy

questions.text: Renal biopsy from a hematuria patient is given below. Which of the following is true about this Condition:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

WIRE loop lesions in SLE suggest active ds and bad prognosis .Mc it is associated with class IV i.e doffuse proliferative GN.

choices.text: Circulating antibodies to PLA2R will correlate prognosis.
Basement membrane Rupture will be seen

questions.text: A 55 years old male presenting with periorbital edema, facial puffiness and massive proteinuria. Renal biopsy has revealed following features under Direct Immunofluorescence (DIF) and electron microscopy (EM) as shown in given picture. All of the following are true regarding this condition except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In membranous glomerulopathy there is no BM rupture.

choices.text: Hyaline arteriolosclerosis will be seen on LM

questions.text: A patient with BP of 190/120 died and autopsy has shown findings given in image. Which of the following is not true about this condition:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Flea bitten kidney is feature of mailgnant HTN which does not show hyaline arteriolosclerosis(Benign HTN)

choices.text: Vacuoles contain both glycogen and lipid.

questions.text: Renal mass was resected and following histopathology was seen. All of the following statements are true regarding this tumour, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Clear cell ca a/w chr 3 deletion.Chromophobe is a/w loss of 1,2,6,7,10

questions.text: Histopathology of a 9 year old boy with brain tumour is shown below. Most likely it is ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

These are rosenthal fibres seen in glial tumor i.e pilocytic astrocytoma and glial tumors are + for GFAP.

choices.text: Most common Primary Malignant brain tumor in adults.
Most common site is frontal lobe.
True Palisading pattern of tumour cells are seen

questions.text:
A 60 -year-old man presents with a 2-week history of tonic-clonic seizures that initially involve his left arm but have more recently progressed to involve his left leg. The seizures are accompanied by muscle weakness but no other eurologic signs. A CT scan reveals a mass in the left cerebral hemisphere.A left frontoparietal craniotomy is performed.

Histologic examination of the brain biopsy is shown in the image. Which of the following is not true about this tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

This is pseudopalisading seen in glioblastoma.it m/c occurs with TERT mutation.

choices.text: It is associated with SHH gene mutation
It is associated with n-MYC amplification.
It will be showing rossestes without neuropil

questions.text: A 10-year-old patient with brain tumour came, and biopsy was taken and shown below in image. Which of the following is false :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Medulloblastoma has pseudorossetes containing neuron component i.e neuropil

choices.text: Most commonly arise from inferior vestibular branch of 8th cranial nerve.
Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni A areas.
Verocay bodies are seen in Antoni B areas

questions.text: Histopathology of a Patient with retrobulbar mass is shown below. Which of the following is not true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Verocay bodies are seen in ANTONY A areas.

choices.text: It is also known as feline esophagus.
It is also known as Allergic esophagitis.
Eosinophilic inflammation may be seen in other organs also.

questions.text: A 45-year-old female was analysed for heartburn history from past 2 months.He also give history of food allergies. Endoscopy, double contrast esophagogram, and biopsy finding is shown below. Which of the following is incorrect about this condition
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

This is eosionophilic esophagitis or feline esophagus which is more then 15 eosinophils/hpf.

choices.text: Decrease in thickness of the mucosa

questions.text: All of the following are true about celiac disease, except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Mucosal thickness remains same in celiac ds.

choices.text: Mutations of the APC gene (Adenomatous Polyposis Coli)

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy was having abdominal pain and malena from past two years. His clinical and radiological examination has revealed the findings consistent with intussusception. Histopathology of lesion is shown below in given image. Which of the following is most likely to be associated with this condition:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PJ Syndrome shows christamas tree pattern and is a/w STK 11 gene mutation.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presenting with nausea, upper abdominal pain, and jaundice following a heavy bout of drinking in a celebration party. Physical examination was eliciting right upper quadrant tenderness. A liver biopsy is obtained, and the microscopic appearance is shown in the figure. What is the nature of the accumulations seen in the biopsy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cytokeratin 8.

questions.text: A 23-year-old male with chronic liver disease was evaluated and found to be having findings given below. This condition is most likely to be associated with which of the following alterations?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sunflower cataract in wilson ds will have high chances for parkinson ds.

choices.text: Multifocal and bilateral metastases is common.
Dyscohesive tumour cells will be seen.
Associated with SNAIL and TWIST gene mutation.

questions.text: A 50-year-old female presenting with right breast lump from past 9 months. She also complaints about headaches associated with nausea for the past 2 months. An H and E stained section is shown in the figure. Which of the following is incorrect about this breast tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Signet ring cells are seen in lobular ca which shows downexpression or loss of E-Cadherin and not overexpression. SNAIL and Twist gene mutation also involved in breast ca.

choices.text: MC breast ca on histology is Invasive Ductal CA

questions.text: A 57-year-old female presented with breast mass. Gross and hostopathology shown below. Which of the following is not true regarding this tumour?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cancer cells block dermal lymphatics

choices.text: Luminal A type, BRCA2 positive, good prognosis.
Luminal B type, BRCA 2 positive, bad prognosis.

questions.text: A 43-year-old-female with breast cancer was showing Luminal Type C. Which of the following is true regarding this cancer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Luminal type C is ER-,PR-,HER 2 NEU + which shows poor prognosis. Trastuzumab is Monoclonal Ab against her 2 neu receptor.

choices.text: Oct3 and oct 4 are molecular markers
Beta- HCG is a tumour marker.
No glandular pattern seen on microscopy.

questions.text: A 43-year-old male came with complains of a vague feeling of painless heaviness in the left scrotum from past 10 months. Testicular mass was resected, gross and histopathology findings are shown below in given image. which of the following is true
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Grossly hemorrhagic/necrotic mass on gross and giant cells( syncytiotrophoblasts) suggest choriocarcinoma .tumor maker is bhcg.

choices.text: Most common testicular tumor in pubertal age group

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy was noticed to be having left testicular mass by his parents. An orchiectomy was performed, and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following is not true about this tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Schiller duval bodies seen in Yolk sac tumor.it is most commonly seen in children and not in pubertal age group

questions.text: A 23-year-old boy was noticed to be having testicular mass • An orchiectomy was performed, Gross and histopathological examination was seen as shown in given image. Which of the following tumor marker will be seen in this tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Gross grey white lobulated mass and microscopic feature showing nests of tumor cells seperated by fibrous septa containing lymphocytes are seen in seminoma.Also tumor cells show peri nuclear Clearing .Tumor markers are LDH,PLAP and beta HCG.

questions.text: A 35-year-old female presented with anterior neck swelling. During childhood she was exposed to radiation. Histopathology of swelling is shown in image. All of the following are true about this condition except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Image shows optically clear chromatin with nuclear grooves. These are features of papillary thyroid ca which have lymphatic spread.

questions.text: 55 years old man is presenting with blurring of vision and massive proteinuria. Fundus examination of eye has revealed cotton wool spots, and dot and blot hemorrhage. Renal biopsy was done for evaluation and is shown below. Most Likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Blurring of visison,Cotton wool spots,dot and blot hemorrhage suggest diabetic retinopathy.Given image shows nodular glomerulosclerosis which is signified by oval pink nodules at periphery.

choices.text: Worst prognosis with hormonal therapy responsive cancer
Worst prognosis without hormonal therapy resistant cancer

questions.text: Breast biopsy with immunohistochemical staining for ER, PR and Her2/neu is shown to be triple negative. Which of the following is true statement?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Triple negative is hormonal therapy resistant with worst prognosis

questions.text: A 28-year-old sexually active female presented with dyspareunia followed by vaginal bleeding showing red, friable, nodular mass on the anterior wall of vagina. Histopathology of lesion is shown in the image. Which of the following conditions is likely to have contributed most to the origin of this neoplasm?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

DES cause clear cell carcinoma of lower genital tract in females.

questions.text: A 28-year-old man has had increasing shortness of breath and breath sounds are decreased in all lung fields. He has family history of liver disease and he had developed marked icterus as a neonate. His liver biopsy stained with PAS shows histopathology given in image. This patient is having high risk for development of which of the following conditions?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PAS positive inclusions in hepatocyte suggest alpha 1 AT defeciency and these patients are prone to develop emphysema.

choices.text: Ground glass hepatocytes of hepatitis-B virus

questions.text: LIVER biopsy showing characteristic cells shown in image. Most Likely diagnosis will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hepatocytes showing eosinophilic granular glassy cytoplasm suggest ground glass hepatocytes seen in hepatitis B Infection

choices.text: Decreased free fatty acid delivery to liver
Increased mitochondrial oxidation of fatty acids

questions.text: A 51 yr old male presents with symptoms that developed following a long weekend of binge drinking. His serum reveals GGT level of 65 IU/L A liver biopsy reveals fatty change (steatosis) of numerous hepatocytes. This patient's liver abnormality is most likely the result of.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Steatosis occurs due to decreased fatty acid oxidation due to increase conversion of NAD into NADH

questions.text: All of the following are true about Peutz-jeghers syndrome, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PJ syndrome is an AD disorder which occurs d/t mutation of APC gene.

choices.text: Patchy inflammatory lesions that extend throughout the bowel wall
Continuous inflammatory changes mostly confined to the mucosa

questions.text:
A 39-year-old woman has had episodes of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea for 2to 3 years. Recently, the episodes became increasingly common, and she noted a weight loss of about 8 pounds. She tells you that one of her uncle have had similar symptoms for years" and Recently one of them had colon cancer.

On Examination, there are no abdominal masses and no fistulas. The most likely findings on colonoscopy with biopsy are:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

No abdominal mass and fistula with h/o abdominal pain and bloody diarrhoea suggest Ulcerative Colitis which shows inflamattory changes(Cryptitis) which is confines to mucosa.

choices.text: All four (A, B, C, & D) are correct.

questions.text:
Which of the following is correct

A. For Serological diagnosis of PSGN, anti-DNAase antibody is better than ASO Ab

B. Most common pattern of inheritence in ALPORT syndrome is XLD.

C. Crescents are made up of parietal epithelial cells, fibrin and Leucocytes

D. On immunofluorescence of Goodpasture syndrome, granular deposits (IgG and C3) are seen.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

GPS shows linear pattern is seen as it is antibody mediated disorder.

questions.text: A 18-Year-old male presents with hematuria. Urinalysis shows , no ketones, no glucose, 1+ blood, and no leukocytes. A renal biopsy reveals tubular epithellal foam cells by Light microscopy. By electron microscopy the glomerular basement membrane shows areas of attenuation, with splitting and lamination of lamina dense in other thickened areas. The most probable diagnosis is-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Male child with deafness ,corneal dystrophy, hematuria suggest ALPORT Syndrome which show Basket weave appearance i.e splitting of lamina densa of Basement Membrane

questions.text: 41 year-old man presented with painless hematuria. Bimanual Examination revealed a mass over the right flank. Subsequently right nephrectomy was done and the mass was seen to be composed of cells with clear cytoplasm. Cytogenetic analysis of this mass is likely to reveal the abnormality of-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Clear cell carcinoma occurs in VHL syndrome which occurs d/t chr 3p deletion

questions.text: Most common finding of lung in COVID 19 infection is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

COVID 19 show 2 microscopic findings of ARDS 1) Diffuse alveolar damage 2) Scant lymphocytic infiltrate

choices.text: Turbulent blood flow through an incompetent mitral valve
Bacterial colonization of an abnormal valve
Cachexia produced by a hypercoagulable state

questions.text: At the time of autopsy of a 49-year-old female who had malar rash, several medium sized vegetations are found on both sides of the mitral valve and tricuspid valve. These cardiac vegetations are most likely the result of -
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Anticardiolipin antibody are seen in SLE which involve both sides of valves,

questions.text: 35-year-old male smoker presents with gangrene of his extremities. Which one of the following histologic findings from a biopsy of the blood vessels supplying this area would be most suggestive of the diagnosis of Buerger's disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Buerger,s ds microscopy shows thrombosis containing neutrophilic microabscess.

questions.text: Histopathology section shows this image from a patent who died of Myocardial infarction. This change will be seen occur after
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Coagulative necrosis along with brisk neutrophilic infiltrate suggest infarct age of 1-3 days

questions.text: A patient of AIDS presents with multiple, purple colored skin nodules on his hands and feet. Biopsy of skin lesion is shown in the image. Which of the following is implicated in pathogenesis of this disorder?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

AIDS pt with skin lesions on LM showing vascular tumor having spindle cells with branching vascular channels suggest KAPOSI sarcoma caused by HHV 8

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl who is normally developed has chronic progressive exercise intolerance. On physical Examination, temperature is 37.1°C, pulse is 70/min, respirations are 14/min, and blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg. A chest radiograph shows cardiomegaly and mild pulmonary edema. An echocardiogram shows severe left ventricular hypertrophy and a prominent interventricular septum. The right ventricle is slightly thickened. The ejection fraction is abnormally high, and the ventricular volume and cardiac output are both low. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the cardiac abnormalities in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Prominent interventricular septum and left ventricular hypertrophy with high ejection fraction and low interventriular volume suggest HOCM which is caused by beta myosin heavy chain mutation
